intro: Lappula leonardii, commonly known as Leonard's lappula, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Lappula leonardii is often found in desert regions and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche.
